intro: Marcetia cinerea, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and ecological gardens.
